column4: okay im about tired of this....im the computer owner and I do love ubuntu dont get me wrong....the other day I tried to edit index.html for the apache server....wouldnt let me....I know I can do it using sudo....but can I change permissions so this doesnt happen anymore??
do I need to do that with every file I want to access?
its not just apache...I could care less about apache
but I tried to move a file from my desktop to /usr/share and get denied
again sorry I mentioned apache...had nothing to do with apache specifically....
I want to be able to move a file to anywhere on the system I want to
and what reason is that?
to save yourself from yourself?
I'm well aware of sudo...I just thought there might be a better way
just add your user to that group and you will have access to edit the html files
chmod
you probably want to create a www group and add your user to it.  Someone else on here might know the "best" way
you can't unless you are root.
there is a reason for that.
so you don't bork your system editing files by accident etc...
who is the group that owns www?
well you chgrp them to www and add your user to that.  I thought there was an apache group to add your user to.
don't do what binarydragon said
just change the permissions for index.html
linux permissions take a little getting use to.  Once you understand why they are the way they are it will all make sense.
it is trust me.
no viruses addware etc...
